awd_titl_txt: Heat Transfer During Thermal Acoustic Oscillations in       Cryogenic Systems
awd_abstract_narration: Thermal acoustic oscillations in tubes inserted into cryogenic                  systems can often introduce large quantities of heat into                       these systems.  Such unwanted heat leaks can seriously degrade                  long term storage of cryogenic fluids.  Very little has been                    done to develop a theoretical analysis of the heat transfer                     process during these oscillations.  The objective of the                        proposed research is to numerically analyze and stimulate                       thermal acoustic oscillations in cryogenic systems,                             particularly in liquid helium and hydrogen systems, predict                     the oscillation pressure amplitude, velocity and temperature                    profiles and finally, experimentally correlate the heat                         transfer associated with these oscillations.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO
